alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jasper (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 22 at 3:58PM CST until February 22 at 4:15PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST FOR JASPER AND NORTHEASTERN CLAY COUNTIES... At 358 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Hidalgo to near Newton, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of Jasper and northeastern Clay Counties, including the following locations... Yale, Newton Lake, Rose Hill, Hunt City, Sam Parr State Park and Bellair. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central, southeastern and east central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln.
